name: Algorithms – Years 6 to 13 (No Directional Graphics)
description: 40 clear algorithmic questions - sequences, patterns, logic, searching, sorting

templates.stem: repeat 5 [ print 'Hello' ] outputs 'Hello' ___ times.
To count from 1 to 10: for i = 1 to ___ [ print i ]
if score > 50 then print 'Pass'. A score of 60 will print: ___
Pattern: 1, 2, 4, 8, ___ (doubling)
if age < 13 then 'child' else ___. For age=15, output is: ___
count = 0; repeat 8 [ count = count + 1 ]; Final count = ___
AND gate: true AND false = ___
OR gate: true OR false = ___
templates.hint: At least one must be true

templates.stem: NOT gate: NOT true = ___
function add(a, b) returns a + b. add(5, 3) = ___
function double(n) returns n × 2. double(7) = ___
for i = 1 to 5 [ sum = sum + i ]; sum = 0 initially. Final sum = ___
Find 7 in list [3,5,7,9,11] using linear search. Position (1-indexed) = ___
Binary search on sorted list [1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8]. Middle element is position ___
Bubble sort one pass on [5,3,8,1]: compare pairs and swap if needed. Result: ___
Selection sort finds minimum. In [9,2,7,4], minimum is ___
Insert 6 into sorted list [3,5,8,9]: ___
Linear search worst case for n items = ___ comparisons
Binary search divides in half each time. 1024 items takes at most ___ comparisons.
Algorithm runs in 5n + 3 steps. Big-O notation = ___
Nested loops: for i=1 to n, for j=1 to n. Total iterations = ___
Selection sort compares all remaining items each pass. Time complexity = ___
function fact(n): if n=1 return 1 else return n × fact(n-1). fact(4) = ___
Fibonacci recursive: fib(0)=0, fib(1)=1, fib(n)=fib(n-1)+fib(n-2). fib(5) = ___
Hash function: h(x) = x mod 10. h(47) = ___
Tower of Hanoi: 3 discs need ___ minimum moves.
Stack: push(5), push(3), pop(), push(7), pop(). Final popped value = ___
Graph with 5 vertices, each connected to all others. Number of edges = ___
Dijkstra's algorithm finds ___ path in weighted graph.
Breadth-first search uses a ___ data structure.
Depth-first search uses a ___ data structure.
Dynamic programming: fibonacci with memoization has time complexity ___
Merge sort divides array in half recursively. Time complexity = ___
Quick sort worst case (already sorted with bad pivot) = ___
AVL tree maintains balance. Height difference between subtrees ≤ ___
Traveling salesman visits n cities. Brute force checks ___ routes.
P vs NP: P problems are solvable in ___ time.
